award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To NICK PHILLIPS for the design and development of the three-axis Libra III remote control camera head.
nomination_description: The Libra III head can accept a range of film cameras and their lenses and allows the operator to add stabilization to each axis for medium focal length lenses. Motion capture and playback are also selectable features.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To FRITZ GABRIEL BAUER for the concept, design and engineering of the Moviecam Superlight 35mm Motion Picture Camera.
nomination_description: The quiet Moviecam Superlight is an extremely small and light 35mm professional motion picture sound camera which allows the cinematographer to film in ways and situations that were never before possible.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To IAIN NEIL for the optical design, RICK GELBARD for the mechanical design, and PANAVISION, INC. for the development of the Millennium Camera System viewfinder.
nomination_description: This unique and versatile viewfinder with two independent viewing positions provides a very high-resolution video assist image, greatly enhancing its application for on-set compositing or non-linear editing.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To HUW GWILYM, KARL LYNCH and MARK V. CRABTREE for the design and development of the AMS Neve Logic Digital Film Console for motion picture sound mixing.
nomination_description: This console allows the user multi-position mixing capabilities, stem routing predub inputs and other filmcentric attributes.  This is the first fully digital audio mixing console specifically designed for post-production film mixing.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To JAMES MOULTRIE for the mechanical design, and to MIKE SALTER and MARK CRAIG GERCHMAN for the optical design of the Cooke S4 Range of Fixed Focal Length Lenses for 35mm motion picture photography.
nomination_description: These state-of-the-art fixed focal length 35mm lenses are the result of intense efforts to meet industry requirements in several areas.  Providing superior performance in several cinematographic aspects, these lenses include a unique linear focus system.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To MARLOWE A. PICHEL for development of the process for manufacturing Electro-formed Metal Reflectors which, when combined with the DC Short Arc Xenon Lamp, became the worldwide standard for motion picture projection systems.
nomination_description: The impact of the Electro-formed Metal Reflector over the decades has completely changed the presentation side of the motion picture industry allowing the replacement of the carbon arc light source and the implementation of automated projection systems.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To L. RON SCHMIDT for the concept, design and engineering of the Linear Loop Film Projectors.
nomination_description: These radically new motion picture film projectors provide superior print handling, image steadiness, screen illumination and enhanced viewer experience by means of an extremely simple air-driven mechanical transport system.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To NAT TIFFEN of Tiffen Manufacturing Corporation for the production of high-quality, durable, laminated color filters for motion picture photography.
nomination_description: Materials of uniform color characteristics are implanted between layers of optical glass and bonded together under extremes of heat and pressure.  The outer surfaces are ground and polished to specified close tolerances, free of distortion and resistant to changes in temperature or humidity, then bound with a protective metal ring.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To VIVIENNE DYER and CHRIS WOOLF for the design and development of the Rycote Microphone Windshield Modular System.
nomination_description: Designed to eliminate physical acoustical rumble and to mask a microphone's high sensitivity to wind and other unwanted noises, the lightweight and rugged Rycote Microphone Windshields accomplish these tasks without altering or impairing the original frequency response of the microphone.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To LESLIE DREVER for the design and development of the Light Wave microphone windscreens and isolation mounts from Light Wave Systems.
nomination_description: Designed to eliminate physical acoustical rumble and to cover a microphone's high sensitivity to wind and other unwanted noises, the Light Wave Systems line of shock mounts and windscreens accomplish these tasks without altering or impairing the original frequency response of the microphone.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To RICHARD C. SEHLIN for the concept, and DR. MITCHELL J. BOGDANOWICZ and MARY L. SCHMOEGER of the Eastman Kodak Company for the design and development of the Eastman Lamphouse Modification Filters.
nomination_description: The ELM Filters enable a laboratory to achieve additive printer contrast and color reproduction using a subtractive lamphouse.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To HOYT H. YEATMAN, JR. of Dream Quest Images and JOHN C. BREWER of the Eastman Kodak Company for the identification and diagnosis leading to the elimination of the "red fringe" artifact in traveling matte composite photography.
nomination_description: The elimination of the "red fringe" artifact in traveling matte composite photography obviates expensive additional computerized image processing thus reducing the time involved in producing a seamless and convincing composite shot.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Academy Award Of Merit)
nomination_citation: To AVID TECHNOLOGY, INC. for the concept, system design and engineering of the Avid Film Composer for motion picture editing.
nomination_description: The Avid Film Composer is a digital, non-linear, 24 frame-per-second editing machine usinig compression algorithms, that has revolutionized the art of film editing.  Shots can be stored, recalled, manipulated and played back instantaneously, allowing the film editor unprecedented creative freedom and the ability to realize a film more fully than before.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To DR. THOMAS G. STOCKHAM, JR. and ROBERT B. INGEBRETSEN for their pioneering work in the areas of waveform editing, crossfades and cut-and-paste techniques for digital audio editing.
nomination_description: The foundation of current digital audio editing equipment for motion pictures has its roots in the late seventies work of these digital pioneers.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To JAMES A. MOORER for his pioneering work in the design of digital signal processing and its application to audio editing for film.
nomination_description: This early work in systems architecture and software has had a significant impact on the digital creation of sound effects and the editing of audio for motion picture sound tracks.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To STEPHEN J. KAY of K-Tec Corporation for the design and development of the Shock Block.
nomination_description: This specially designed ground fault interrupter eliminates the electric shock hazard when working in water, wet conditions or from an accidentally exposed power line.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To GARY TREGASKIS for the primary design; and to DOMINIQUE BOISVERT, PHILIPPE PANZINI and ANDRÉ LeBLANC for the development and implementation of the Flame and Inferno software.
nomination_description: The Inferno System, and its predecessor, Flame, provide high-speed, efficient integrated digital compositing and visual effects tools.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To ROBERT PREDOVICH, JOHN SCOTT, MOHAMED KEN T. HUSAIN and CAMERON SHEARER for the design and implementation of the Soundmaster Integrated Operations Nucleus operating environment.
nomination_description: The Soundmaster system provides motion picture audio post production facilities with a completely integrated capability for synchronization of audio and picture elements with the numerous methods of synchronization in use today.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To ROY B. FERENCE, STEVEN R. SCHMIDT, RICHARD J. FEDERICO, ROCKWELL YARID and MICHAEL E. McCRACKAN for the design and development of the Kodak Lightning Laser Recorder.
nomination_description: The Kodak Lightning laser recorder system established higher operational and quality standards and achieved wide industry acceptance for digital film recording onto intermediate film stock.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To COLIN MOSSMAN, HANS LEISINGER and GEORGE JOHN ROWLAND of Deluxe Laboratories for the concept and design of the Deluxe High Speed Spray Film Cleaner.
nomination_description: This innovative and effective high speed film cleaning machine is unique in its use of spray technology, providing the flexibility to use alternative solvents, and to anticipate changes in environmental legislation.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To ARNOLD & RICHTER CINE TECHNIK, and ARRI USA, INC. for the concept and engineering of the Arriflex 435 Camera System.
nomination_description: The 435 enhances the creative process via its programmability and reliability, and provides the camera operator with the widest feature and performance capability of any MOS camera in use today.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To ARNOLD & RICHTER CINE TECHNIK and the CARL ZEISS COMPANY for the concept and optical design of the Carl Zeiss/Arriflex Variable Prime Lenses.
nomination_description: This series of variable prine lenses opens many creative possibilities, since any focal length can be continuously selected throughout the entire range.  They offer sharp, high-contrast, high-resolution images with minimized vignetting, superior to many prime lenses.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To DEREK C. LIGHTBODY of OpTex for the design and development of Aurasoft Luminaires.
nomination_description: The Aurasoft offers a radical new type of reflector design for the production of soft, very even and relatively shadowless light, with superior coverage and significantly higher intensity than existing softlights.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To MARK ROBERTS, RONAN CARROLL, ASSAFF RAWNER, PAUL BARTLETT and SIMON WAKLEY for the creation of the Milo Motion-Control Crane.
nomination_description: This radically original and effective solution to the problems of high-speed camera motion was achieved with the combination of novel geometry and dedicated 3-dimensional control software.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To MICHAEL SORENSEN and RICHARD ALEXANDER of Sorensen Designs International, and DONALD TRUMBULL for advancing the state-of-the-art of real-time motion-control, as exemplified in the Gazelle and Zebra camera dolly systems.
nomination_description: Over the past decade, Sorensen, Alexander and Trumbull have improved the speed, repeatability and portability of robotic camera platforms through novel engineering concepts and the pioneering use of composite materials.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To RONALD E. UHLIG, THOMAS F. POWERS and FRED M. FUSS of the Eastman Kodak Company for the design and development of KeyKode latent-image barcode key numbers.
nomination_description: KeyKode numbers are machine-readable bar codes on camera negative films that exactly replicate the human-readable key numbers. Together with an appropriate reader and database software, they reduce errors and speed important post-production operations, leading to significant cost savings.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To IAIN NEIL for the optical design; TAKUO MIYAGISHIMA for the mechanical design; and PANAVISION, INCORPORATED, for the concept and development of the Primo Series of spherical prime lenses for 35mm cinematography.
nomination_description: The Primo Series of lenses for 35mm cinematography represents a thorough and comprehensive approach to prime lens design, development and manufacture.  This family of lenses has a wide range of focal lengths, all color matched, with improved modulation transfer function characteristics.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To GARRETT BROWN and JERRY HOLWAY for the creation of the Skyman flying platform for Steadicam operators.
nomination_description: This cable-driven, manned camera platform allows the operator to spin 360 degrees for unimpeded pans while controlling the downhill speed via brakes.  As a device for achieving otherwise impossible shots, Skyman has had a definite influence on later cable-suspended camera systems.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To JAMES RODNUNSKY, JAMES WEBBER and BOB WEBBER of Cablecam Systems, and TROU BAYLISS for the design and engineering of Cablecam.
nomination_description: This radio-controlled, cable-driven camera platform with its ultra-smooth synthetic cables and powerful hydraulic motors, enables runs in excess of 3000 feet with quick return to start.  Operating unmanned, it can function at speeds and through perils that would be unsafe for on-board operators.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To DAVID DiFRANCESCO, BALA S. MANIAN and THOMAS L. NOGGLE for their pioneering efforts in the development of laser film recording technology.
nomination_description: This pioneering laser film recorder, designed and used for motion pictures, demonstrated the potential of this technology for recording digital data onto intermediate film stock.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To MICHAEL MacKENZIE, MIKE BOLLES, UDO PAMPEL and JOSEPH FULMER of Industrial Light & Magic for their pioneering work in motion-controlled, silent camera dollies.
nomination_description: This silent, high-speed motion control modification of a Panther dolly makes it possible to film moving camera composite shots of actors while recording live dialogue.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To BARRY WALTON, BILL SCHULTZ, CHRIS BARKER and DAVID CORNELIUS of Sony Pictures Imageworks for the creation of an advanced motion-controlled, silent camera dolly.
nomination_description: This extensive modification to the Panther dolly allows high-speed moves to be silent, smooth and stable.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To BRUCE WILTON and CARLOS ICINKOFF of Mechanical Concepts for their modular system of motion-control rotators and movers for use in motion-control.
nomination_description: These components have become the de facto industry standard for use in precision motion control equipment.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To REMY SMITH for the software and electronic design and development; and JAMES K. BRANCH and NASIR J. ZAIDI for the design and development of the Spectra Professional IV-A digital exposure meter.
nomination_description: The design and execution of the Spectra Professional IV-A meter has resulted in a practical and successful tool for the film production community.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To IVAN KRUGLAK for his commitment to the development of a wireless transmission system for video-assisted images for the motion picture industry.
nomination_description: Through years of persistent effort, Mr. Kruglak has commercialized and popularized a technique of great utility for motion picture camera operations.  By introducing diversity antennas and a time code insertion accessory, he has optimized camera wireless video-assist components.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To DR. DOUGLAS R. ROBLE for his contribution to tracking technology and for the design and implementation of the TRACK system for camera position calculation and scene reconstruction.
nomination_description: The TRACK system is an integrated software tool that uses computer-vision techniques to extract critical 2D and 3D information about a scene and the camera used to film it.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To THADDEUS BEIER for the design and implementation of ras_track, a system for 2D tracking, stabilization, and 3D camera and object tracking.
nomination_description: Ras_track allows the user to determine the postiton and location of the camera and objects in a scene by tracking points in a scanned sequence.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To MANFRED N. KLEMME and DONALD E. WETZEL for the design and development of the K-Tek Microphone Boom Pole and accessories for on-set motion picture sound recording.
nomination_description: The K-TEK series microphone boom pole provides production recording personnel with a self-lubricated, light-weight, sturdy pole with multiple accessories.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To NICK FOSTER for his software development in the field of water simulation systems.
nomination_description: This software technique provides an efficient and flexible method for the creation of flowing streams, oceans, tidal waves and turbulence for motion picture visual effects.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To CARY PHILLIPS for the design and development of the "Caricature" Animation System at Industrial Light & Magic.
nomination_description: By integrating existing tools into a powerful interactive system, and adding an expressive multi-target shape interpolation-based freeform animation system, the "Caricature" system provides a degree of subtlety and refinement not possible with other systems.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To DR. MITCHELL J. BOGDANOWICZ of the Eastman Kodak Company, and JIM MEYER and STAN MILLER of Rosco Laboratories, Inc. for the design of the CalColor Calibrated Color Effects Filters.
nomination_description: Designed to correspond to the spectral sensitivity of color negative film stocks, these filters provide for improved color control in motion picture lighting.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To DR. A. TULSI RAM, RICHARD C. SEHLIN, DR. CARL F. HOLTZ and DAVID F. KOPPERL of the Eastman Kodak Company for the research and development of the concept of molecular sieves applied to improve the archival properties of processed photographic film.
nomination_description: The use of zeolite crystals as molecular sieves to absorb moisture, acetic acid, methylene chloride and a variety of solvents created an effective deterrent to the effects of vinegar syndrome in stored film stock.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To TAKUO MIYAGISHIMA and ALBERT K. SAIKI of Panavision, Inc. for the design and development of the Eyepiece Leveler.
nomination_description: This leveler keeps the camera eyepiece at the same level, regardless of whether the camera position is tilted up or down, enabling the camera operator to concentrate on the composition of the image.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To EDMUND M. DI GIULIO and JAMES BARTELL of Cinema Products for the design of the KeyKode Sync Reader.
nomination_description: The KeyKode Sync Reader provides a fast, accurate and user-friendly means of utilizing the KeyKode information on film, thereby expediting the editorial and post-production processes.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To IVAN KRUGLAK for his pioneering concept and the development of the Coherent Time Code Slate.
nomination_description: Time code slates have had significant impact on the filmmaking process by simplifying post-production.  This development makes the synchronization process faster and more precise, particularly when multiple cameras are used.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To MIKE DENECKE for refining and further developing electronic time code slates.
nomination_description: Due to their features and simplified operational procedures, the Denecke slates have had significant impact on the motion picture industry and have become the standard for electronic time code slates.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Technical Achievement Award)
nomination_citation: To ED ZWANEVELD and FREDERICK GASOI of the National Film Board of Canada, and MIKE LAZARIDIS and DALE BRUBACHER-CRESSMAN of Research in Motion for the design and development of the DigiSync Film KeyKode Reader.
nomination_description: The DigiSync Film KeyKode Reader provides a fast, accurate and user-friendly means of utilizing the KeyKode information on film, expediting the editorial and post-production processes.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Academy Award Of Merit)
nomination_citation: To GUNNAR P. MICHELSON for the engineering and development of an improved, electronic, high-speed, precision light valve for use in motion picture printing machines.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To WILLIAM KOVACS for his creative leadership and ROY HALL for his principal engineering efforts that led to the Wavefront Advanced Visualizer computer graphics system.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
nomination_citation: To JOHN GIBSON, ROB KRIEGER, MILAN NOVACEK, GLEN OZYMOK and DAVE SPRINGER for the development of the geometric modeling component of the Alias PowerAnimator System.

award: Scientific And Technical Award (Scientific And Engineering Award)
